companions_stunts.description: Advancements and special powers available to PCs who complete the Companions questline.

breath_of_ysgramor.name: Breath of Ysgramor
breath_of_ysgramor.unlock_flavor: As Kodlak's spirit ascends toward Sovngarde, a warmth passes through you - not the wild heat of the beast, but something older and cleaner. Ysgramor's ancestors acknowledge the deeds done in honor.
breath_of_ysgramor.effect: Invoke the warrior-spirit of Ysgramor's legacy. Choose one: (a) clear all physical stress and one mild consequence, drawing on the resolve of generations of Companions; or (b) add +3 to a single Fight roll as the Harbinger's authority fills your arm.

scaling.base: Once per session, choose option (a) or (b).
scaling.upgraded: At a major milestone after completing the arc, unlock both options per session.

breath_of_ysgramor.aspect_notes: Once per session when using this power, the PC may also create the 'Harbinger's Legacy' scene aspect with 1 free invoke representing the Companions' morale rising at their leader's example.
breath_of_ysgramor.notes: This power is only fully unlocked if Kodlak was cured before death (companions_state.kodlak_cured == true). If Kodlak was not cured, the power still unlocks but only option (b) is available - the beast-taint in the legacy means the healing aspect of option (a) is unavailable.

werewolf_form.name: Werewolf Form
werewolf_form.unlock_flavor: The blood burns through you and the world becomes sharper - smells like iron, sounds like prey. You are wolf now.
werewolf_form.cost: Once per session; lasts one scene
werewolf_form.effect: Transform into werewolf form for one scene. While transformed: Fight and Physique are treated as Great (+4) regardless of base skill; you ignore your first mild consequence each scene; you cannot use social skills (Rapport, Empathy, Deceive) as the beast overrides social reasoning. At end of scene, make a Will roll vs Fair (+2) or take a mild mental consequence 'Shame of the Wolf'.
werewolf_form.notes: Only available if embraced_curse == true. Kodlak views this power with sadness; using it in his presence costs 1 trust with Kodlak. Skjor approves (+1 trust with Skjor when used effectively).
